measured_by: performance in the Unconscious Thought (UT) distraction condition of the problem-solving paradigm
justification: “The first hypothesis is tested as a difference in decision quality between an UT condition, in which participants are distracted from thinking about the problem for a while, and the immediate condition (IM).”

measured_by: performance in the Conscious Thought (CT) deliberation condition of the problem-solving paradigm
justification: “The second hypothesis predicts a difference in decision quality of the UT condition relative to a condition in which participants were allowed to think about the problem. This is the CT condition …”

measured_by: number of correct versus incorrect choices in multi-attribute decision tasks
justification: Table 1 notes that “The DV is … a Binary Response (Correct / Incorrect Choice),” indicating decision quality was operationalised as correctness of choices.

measured_by: difference in decision quality between UT and CT (and/or IM) conditions
justification: The article explains that “The experimental design … compares the quality of participants’ decisions across the levels of a factor that represents different modes of thought (MOT),” so the UTE is observed as the decision-quality gap between those conditions.
